Classes

class granule(hFile, short_name)

This class will unpack the data from a downloaded granule in .h5 format

Parameters:

  • hFile (string) – path to granule (file extension ‘.h5’)

  • short_name (string) – data product short name (e.g., ‘ATL03’)

Variables:

  • product – data product short name

  • tracks – available ground tracks (‘gt1l’, ‘gt1r’, ‘gt2l’, ‘gt2r’, ‘gt3l’, ‘gt3r’)

  • alt – elevation data (either profile (‘ATL06’) or photon cloud (‘ATL03’))

  • lat – data point latitudes

  • lon – data point longitudes

Versionadded:

0.1.0

Versionchanged:

0.1.0

class gt(alt, lon, lat)

Ground track class. Inverted class structure in which data are organized according to their ground track. A later version will likely pick one of these organizations and stick with it.

Identical subclasses are initialized by granule for all ground tracks (‘gt[1|2|3][l|r]’)

Parameters:

  • alt (list) – elevation data

  • lat (list) – data point latitudes

  • lon (list) – data point longitudes

Versionadded:

0.1.0

Versionchanged:

0.1.0

Functions

getPolygon(pfile):

Download polygon text file as an array. File must be formatted as a comma separated list of lon, lat coordinates specified in counter clock-wise order with matching first and last lon/lat pairs. (e.g., ‘lon1, lat1, lon2, lat2, …’)

Returns:

L x 2 array of lat lon coordinates

Return type:

numpy array
